page.title: 18The W.R.A.C. Camp, Guildford
page.content: {The Women's Royal Army Corps,Guildford Separate training is given for recruits, warrant officers and non-commissioned officers. They do not train with weapons. These are used for defensive purposes only. The camp was opened in 1941, rebuilt in 1964 and opened by the Queen. It covers 51 acres of land. They have four types of sleeping accommodation: the officers' mess, sergeants' mess, recruit and staff accommodation and warrant officers' mess.They have four types of uniform: summer, winter, a summer dress and a parade uniform. The highest rank a woman can have here is a full colonel. To be able to join you need to be 17 years 3 months. It has the largest parade square in the U.K. The band is the only female service band left. There are two chapels and a medical centre.
